documentType: Federal Bureau of Prisons Office Memorandum / Inmate Profile & Discipline Record
summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum and inmate profile for Nicholas Tartaglione, detailing his status as a pre-trial inmate and reporting an incident where his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein, was found sitting on the ground staring at him in their cell after midnight. The document includes Tartaglione's disciplinary history and housing assignment.

persons.name: Nicholas John Tartaglione
persons.context: A 51-year-old white male inmate at the New York MCC, charged with murder and drug conspiracy. He was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate and reported the incident where Epstein was found staring at him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, cellmate of Nicholas Tartaglione. The document describes an incident where he was observed sitting on the ground staring at Tartaglione after midnight, prompting Tartaglione to call for staff assistance.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell at the New York MCC. Tartaglione reported an incident involving Epstein staring at him after midnight.

events.title: Interview regarding cell incident
events.description: An interview was conducted with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione at 2:50 PM regarding an incident that occurred with his cellmate Jeffrey Epstein after midnight, where Epstein was found sitting on the ground staring at him.

events.title: Tartaglione housed with Epstein
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione was housed in cell Z06-215UAD at the New York MCC, sharing the cell with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Tartaglione disciplinary incident for fighting
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione received a disciplinary report for fighting with another person, resulting in 30 days of disciplinary segregation (suspended pending 180 days clear conduct).

events.title: Tartaglione pending report for possessing hazardous tool
events.description: A pending disciplinary report for possessing a hazardous tool (referred to as a cell phone in the memorandum) was filed against Tartaglione, referred to UDC for further sanctions.

keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the New York MCC in July 2019.
Tartaglione reported an incident where he woke up after midnight to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, leading him to call for staff assistance.
Tartaglione was a pre-trial inmate facing charges of murder and drug conspiracy under 21 U.S.C. ยง 848(E).
Tartaglione had a disciplinary history including fighting, giving/accepting money without authorization, mail abuse, and a pending report for possessing a hazardous tool (cell phone).
The document is dated July 23, 2019, and includes an inmate profile and disciplinary record for Tartaglione alongside the incident report involving Epstein.
